summary: In Greek mythology, Ganymede was a very handsome young man from Troy. The gods, especially Zeus, fell in love with him. Zeus took Ganymede to Mount Olympus to be his cupbearer. This story represents an ancient Greek custom where older men formed romantic relationships with younger boys. Ganymede's name is also linked to the Latin word 'Catamitus', which describes such relationships. Some ancient texts suggest Zeus's love for Ganymede was very strong.
title: Ganymede (mythology)
